alert.note: Alert for Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 10:29AM EDT until July 29 at 9:13PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Letcher. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1029 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitesburg, Letcher, Jenkins, Fleming-Neon, Blackey, Whitco, Marlowe, Ice, Dongola, Bellcraft, Crown, Trailer, Day, Ermine, Van, Oscaloosa, Colly, Southdown, Oven Fork and Tillie.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
